texts.definition: Game elements that allow players to perform actions in game worlds.
markups: <style="Definition">Game elements that allow players to perform actions in game worlds.</style>

Games that have game worlds need to have ways of letting players perform actions within these worlds. <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> are the game elements that provide such actions and let players chose how to use these in order to achieve whatever types of goals they do have.
<style="H3">Examples</style>

Each piece in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Chess">Chess</link></style> acts as a <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> for the players by providing a number of potential actions. The stones used in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Go">Go</link></style> are only <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> when they are being placed on the board, since players cannot perform any other actions through them later.

Avatars are players' <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">First-Person Shooters</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/America's%20Army">America's Army</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dead%20Space">Dead Space</link></style>, and the various installments of the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Quake%20series">Quake</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Crysis%20series">Crysis</link></style>,  and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Uncharted%20series">Uncharted series</link></style>.

The units under players command in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Warhammer%2040K">Warhammer 40K</link></style>, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Starcraft%20series">Starcraft series</link></style>, and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hearts%20of%20Iron%20series">Hearts of Iron series</link></style> are all examples of <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> for players. In these games, as in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Sims%20series">Sims series</link></style>, players are also equipped with a cursor that not only lets them select with units (or Sims) to control but also lets them directly interface with some other parts of the game environment.
<style="H2">Using the pattern</style>

<style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> are ways to locate players' abilities to affect gameplay in <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>. The four main options for this are <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="characters">Characters</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="god-fingers">God Fingers</link></style> (primarily <style="Link"><link="player-characters">Player Characters</link></style> in the case of <style="Link"><link="characters">Characters</link></style>). The first three can maintain a <style="Link"><link="diegetic-consistency">Diegetic Consistency</link></style>, but only as long as the actions they provide are restricted by the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Alternative%20Realities">Alternative Realities</link></style> of the games in question. While <style="Link"><link="characters">Characters</link></style> may be unnecessary in <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> that have  consistent representations, they can provide <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> in the mainly implied <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Tabletop%20Roleplaying%20Games">Tabletop Roleplaying Games</link></style> and provide support for actions that are smaller than the granularity of explicit action presentation in <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>.

<style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> naturally provide players with several <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> but this can also be supported by allowing players to switch between different <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="characters">Characters</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="god-fingers">God Fingers</link></style> are quite often combined with these other types of <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> in these situations since <style="Link"><link="god-fingers">God Fingers</link></style> provide a way easily switching between the other <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style>; they may also allow actions otherwise not possible (e.g. activating production of <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> in buildings in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Real-Time%20Strategy%20Games">Real-Time Strategy Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Starcraft%20series">Starcraft series</link></style>). Such use of several <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> can  allows single players to control <style="Link"><link="parties">Parties</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> at high levels of granularity but requires <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attention%20Swapping">Attention Swapping</link></style>. This type of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attention%20Swapping">Attention Swapping</link></style> can be removed by allowing players to activate actions for several <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> at once - something present in both <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Real-Time%20Strategy%20Games">Real-Time Strategy Games</link></style> such the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Starcraft%20series">Starcraft series</link></style> and other computer-based <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Strategy%20Games">Strategy Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hearts%20of%20Iron%20series">Hearts of Iron series</link></style>. This solution is however unlikely to remove <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attention%20Swapping">Attention Swapping</link></style> completely from games since those that have this type of gameplay are likely to create situations where the various <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> cannot effectively be used by making them all perform the same actions.

Although not as common as the four options mention above, <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> can, especially in <style="Link"><link="collectible-card-games">Collectible Card Games</link></style>, be <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> either when being played or by being in play and giving a player <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New Abilities</link></style>. This of course assumes that <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> that can be affected are at least implied, but examples of games that do this include <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Magic:%20The%20Gathering">Magic: The Gathering</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Race%20for%20the%20Galaxy">Race for the Galaxy</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="tiles">Tiles</link></style> offer the same design possibilities as <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> in this respect, but are also quite often used to create the actual <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="bookkeeping-tokens">Bookkeeping Tokens</link></style> whose presences indicate that a player has <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New Abilities</link></style> are another form of more unusual <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style>. <style="Link"><link="dice">Dice</link></style> are seldom <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> except in pure dice games, since using them is not usually an activity affecting the game directly but rather a way of determining how actions are to be performed. <style="Link"><link="installations">Installations</link></style> can become <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> even if they are often found in games with <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> and play a lesser role than these. This most occurs in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Real-Time%20Strategy%20Games">Real-Time Strategy Games</link></style>.

While different <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> can of course affect <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> is vastly different ways, one way that most <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> can affect <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> is to give <style="Link"><link="area-control">Area Control</link></style> by being present in specific part of them (<style="Link"><link="god-fingers">God Fingers</link></style> are the typical exception). In contrast, <style="Link"><link="line-sight">Line of Sight</link></style> is a general way in which <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> powers of affecting <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> can be changed. <style="Link"><link="clickability">Clickability</link></style> is a way of changing how affecting <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> through <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> is perceived and can be applied to most <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> but works most easily with <style="Link"><link="god-fingers">God Fingers</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> can change through the <style="Link"><link="abstract-player-construct-development">Abstract Player Construct Development</link></style> of being giving <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New Abilities</link></style>. Although these are typically giving as immaterial <style="Link"><link="rewards">Rewards</link></style>, it is worth mentioning that they sometimes are represented through tangible <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="tiles">Tiles</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="bookkeeping-tokens">Bookkeeping Tokens</link></style>.

Making <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> be <style="Link"><link="always-vulnerable">Always Vulnerable</link></style> is a simple way to focus players' attention more on these loci as well as their immediate surroundings.
<style="H3">Diegetic Aspects</style>

The diegetic aspects of <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> depend primarily on what type of <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> they are, so refer to the patterns that instantiate <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> for more details.
<style="H3">Interface Aspects</style>

<style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> is an <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Interface%20Patterns">Interface Pattern</link></style>. The various <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> do have relations to what views players are given in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Computer%20Games">Computer-Based Games</link></style>, e.g. <style="Link"><link="god-fingers">God Fingers</link></style> not being possible to combine with <style="Link"><link="first-person-views">First-Person Views</link></style>. For this reason, considering various <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> should be done in conjunction with <style="Link"><link="first-person-views">First-Person</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="third-person-views">Third-Person</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="god-views">God Views</link></style>. A special note in relation to this is that <style="Link"><link="third-person-views">Third-Person Views</link></style> can be locked to the current <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> in games with <style="Link"><link="god-views">God Views</link></style> and multiple possible <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style>, this to support players being conscious of which <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> is being used.

<style="Link"><link="geospatial-game-widgets">Geospatial Game Widgets</link></style> are <style="Link"><link="game-state-indicators">Game State Indicators</link></style> that can be used to provide players with abstract information pertaining to their <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> (e.g. <style="Link"><link="health">Health</link></style> or presenting their <style="Link"><link="handles">Handle</link></style>) but can also be used to show which <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> is or are selected when several are available. One example of this is the signature green icon above selected Sims in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Sims%20series">Sims series</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="mini">Mini-maps</link></style> in contrast can be used to show where players' <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> are located in the <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>.
<style="H3">Narrative Aspects</style>

The specific choice of <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> used in a game can affect which types of <style="Link"><link="narration-structures">Narration Structures</link></style> are suitable. For example, <style="Link"><link="detective-structures">Detective Structures</link></style> is difficult to use with <style="Link"><link="god-fingers">God Fingers</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> since they allow players information from a non-diegetic perspective or from several different diegetic individuals. In contrast, the type of <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> chosen can affect how the specifics of <style="Link"><link="predetermined-story-structures">Predetermined Story Structures</link></style> can be designed.
<style="H2">Consequences</style>

<style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> are game elements that provide methods for players to affect <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>, and are in many cases diegetically present in the <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> themselves. These <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> can support <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Engrossment">Engrossment</link></style> in various ways depending on their specific characteristics, but very often <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Spatial%20Engrossment">Spatial Engrossment</link></style> since they make players focus to specific parts of <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> at a time and quite likely <style="Link"><link="movement">Movement</link></style> or relations between parts of <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>. They also create natural elements within games for players to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Identification">Identify</link></style> their gameplay experiences and efforts with, and when present in the <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> represent <style="Link"><link="agents">Agents</link></style> in these.

Providing multiple <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> can support <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Attention%20Swapping">Attention Swapping</link></style> but may also create it by the individual <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> having <style="Link"><link="attention-demanding-gameplay">Attention Demanding Gameplay</link></style>. This may also affects <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Risk/Reward">Risk/Reward</link></style> trade-offs that have to be made when initiating <style="Link"><link="extended-actions">Extended Actions</link></style>.

The choice of <style="CurrentLink">Focus Loci</style> in games dictate which game elements players have direct control over and which they have <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Indirect%20Control">Indirect Control</link></style> over.
